Connection name: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3, %4

There are currently no resources available in this connection.
Your workplace administrator might not have published any programs or desktops for you to access.
In the future, use RemoteApp and Desktop Connections in Control Panel to check for updates to this connection.
Connection name: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3, %4

There are currently no resources available in this connection.
Your workplace administrator might not have published any programs or desktops for you to access.
In the future, use RemoteApp and Desktop Connections in Control Panel to check for updates to this connection.
Connection name: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3, %4

There is a problem with this connection's security certificate.
The remote computer cannot be authenticated due to problems with its security certificate.
Security certificate problems might indicate an attempt to fool you or intercept data you send to the remote computer.
Windows cannot continue setting up this connection. Contact your workplace administrator for assistance.
Connection name: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3, %4

There is a problem with this connection's security certificate.
The remote computer cannot be authenticated due to problems with its security certificate.
Security certificate problems might indicate an attempt to fool you or intercept data you send to the remote computer.
Windows cannot continue setting up this connection. Contact your workplace administrator for assistance.

The connection has been successfully removed:
Connection name: %1
Connection URL: %2

Multiple resources are associated with the same file extensions. Resources: %1. Associated file extensions: %2. Only one of these resources will be associated as the default program. To resolve this issue, change the file association settings for one or more of these resources so that they do not attempt to associate as the default program for the same extension.

Connection discovery was successful.
Discovery hint: %1 Connection URL: %2
Connection discovery failed. Contact your workplace administrator for assistance. Discovery hint: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3
Connection discovery failed. The URL that was discovered is not a valid connection URL. Contact your workplace administrator for assistance. Discovery hint: %1 Connection URL: %2 Error code: %3

An error occurred while Windows was installing file-type associations for the default connection. You will not be able to open files with the %1 RemoteApp program because the program couldn't be associated with any file types. Contact your workplace administrator for assistance.
Connection name: %2 Connection URL: %3 Error code: %4

The installation of the default connection has been cancelled. A default connection cannot be used on a system that is part of a Remote Desktop Services deployment.
